info.title: Rapidata Order API
info.description: The API for the Rapidata Order service

post.summary: Creates a new job from a job definition and audience.
Creates a new revision for an existing job definition.

get.summary: Gets the latest revision for a job definition.

delete.summary: Deletes a job definition and all its revisions.

get.summary: Gets a job definition by its id.
Downloads the results of a job as a file attachment.
Gets a job by its id.
Gets the results of a job as a JSON string.
Gets a specific revision for a job definition.

requestBody.description: The body content of the request

get.summary: Queries job definitions based on filter, page, and sort criteria.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The parameters for filtering, paging, and sorting

get.summary: Queries job revisions for a specific definition based on filter, page, and sort criteria.

parameters.name: definitionId
parameters.description: The id of the job definition

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The parameters for filtering, paging, and sorting

get.summary: Queries jobs based on filter, page, and sort criteria.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The parameters for filtering, paging, and sorting

get.summary: Queries orders based on a filter, page, and sort criteria.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The parameters for filtering, paging, and sorting

get.summary: Retrieves the orders aggregated by customer, with total amounts and most recent order informations.
Retrieves orders that are public and can be cloned by any user.
Retrieves an order by its id.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to delete

get.summary: Aggregates the results of an order and returns the result as a json body.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order

get.summary: Aggregates the results of an order and returns it as a file attachment.
get.description:
Returns the aggregated result as a file with a given name.
 The annotated type of the response represents the content type of the file.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order

post.summary: Used to create a new order.
Creates a new order with a custom pipeline.

requestBody.description: The body content of the request

post.summary: Notifies the admins that a user wants to create an order with an unsupported label type or data type.

requestBody.description: The body content of the request

post.description: In order to clone an order, the existing order must be marked as public.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to clone

requestBody.description: The body content of the request

post.description:
When an order is cloned only the necessary information is copied.
 In order to make changes to the order, it must be unlocked first.
 Unlocking the order will clone the entire dataset and its datapoints.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to unlock

patch.summary: Updates whether an order is a demo or not.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to update

parameters.name: isDemo
parameters.description: Whether to mark or unmark the order as a demo

patch.summary: Updates whether an order is public or not.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to update

parameters.name: isPublic
parameters.description: Whether to mark or unmark the order as public

post.description:
Once an order is created its order id and dataset id is returned.
 The dataset id can be used to fill the dataset with data points.
 Once submitted, the order will be locked and no further changes can be made.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to submit

requestBody.description: The model containing additional information for the submission.

post.summary: Approves an order that has been submitted for manual approval.
post.description:
An order is submitted for manual approval when the automatic approval process could not automatically
 determine if the order is safe to process.
 Once an order is approved, the pipeline will start processing the order.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to approve

patch.summary: Updates the name of an order.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to update

requestBody.description: The body content of the request

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to retry

post.summary: Pauses an order that is processing. Meaning all campaigns in the order will be paused.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to pause

post.summary: Puts the order into preview mode, where one can inspect what our labelers receive.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to submit

requestBody.description: The model containing additional information for the preview.

post.summary: Resumes a paused order. Meaning all campaigns in the order will be resumed.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to resume

Bearer.description: JWT Authorization header using the Bearer scheme

OAuth2.description: OAuth2 authorization header using the Bearer scheme
